text: The major findings in the present study are that <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling showed cellular specific responses of NF-kappaB phosphorylation in the PC following SE , which may be related to vasogenic edema formation followed by neutrophil infiltration .
BBB disruption has been reported in experimental and human epilepsy [ 12 , 13 , 15 , 16 , 28 ] .
Leakage of serum-derived components into the extracellular space is associated with hyperexcitability and seizure onset [ 12 , 13 , 15 , 16 , 28 ] .
Furthermore , dysfunction of the BBB leads to epileptogenesis and contributes to progression of epilepsy [ 12 , 13 , 15 , 16 , 28 ] .
In the present study , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactivity was obviously observed in microglia in the PC following SE .

TNF receptor expressions were also up-regulated in astrocytes ( <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TNFp75R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and endothelial cells ( <extra_id_0> TNFp75R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

Furthermore , blockade of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling by s <extra_id_0> TNFp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion effectively ( but not completely ) reduced volumes of SE - induced vasogenic edema and neuronal damage in the PC .

These findings indicate that <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may participate in astroglial and endothelial responses to SE , which are relevant to SE - induced vasogenic edema formation [ 5-8 ] .
Indeed , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling increases BBB permeability in various experimental disease models [ 29 ] .
In the present study , s <extra_id_0> TNFp55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion could not completely prevent SE - induced vasogenic edema and neuronal damage in the PC .
Therefore , our findings suggest that <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling may not be a unique upstream event in vasogenic edema development .

<extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation of NF-kappaB enhances its transactivation potential , and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation occurs in either the cytoplasm or the nucleus [ 30 ] .

In the present study , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Thr435 immunoreactivity was detected in endothelial cells , and its immunoreactivity showed an inverse correlation to the degree of SMI-71 expression .
SMI-71 , an endothelial barrier antigen , is a protein expressed by endothelial cells of rat BBB [ 31 ] .
Under pathological conditions , SMI-71 expression is lost in endothelial cells [ 5 , 7 , 8 , 30 , 32 ] .
Acute phases of the above pathological conditions are accompanied by opening of the BBB and development of vasogenic edema [ 33 ] .

Indeed , neutralization of SMI-71 in vivo leads to widening of intercellular junctions between endothelial cells and swelling of perivascular astrocytic processes [ 34 ] , although SMI-71 is not localized at endothelial cell junctions [ 35-38 ] .
In the present study , SMI-71 immunoreactivity was significantly reduced in blood vessels 1 day after SE when vasogenic edema and neuronal damage were observed .
Furthermore , s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion effectively prevented SE - induced SMI-71 down-regulation .

With respect to the phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Thr435 by <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 39 ] , our findings indicate that <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Thr435 phosphorylation in endothelial cells may play an important role in vasogenic edema induction via SMI-71 degradation or its posttranslational dysfunction influencing BBB permeability .

In our previous studies [ 5 , 8 ] , <extra_id_0> dystrophin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( an <extra_id_0> actin-binding protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 40 ] ) immunoreactivity was detected in blood vessels and in astrocytic perivascular end-feet , and was down-regulated 12 hrs after SE prior to the appearance of vasogenic edema and down-regulation of SMI-71 immunoreactivity .
With respect to this previous report , changes in SMI immunoreactivity would be causes / results of interaction between endothelial cells and perivascular astrocytes .

In the present study , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser276 , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser311 , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser529 , and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser536 phosphorylation was observed in astrocytes following SE .

Furthermore , s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion effectively inhibited <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser276 and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser311phosphorylation in astrocytes following SE .

Therefore , it is likely that enhanced <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser276 and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser311 phosphorylation may be involved in <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - alpha - mediated BBB disruption .

However , s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion could not prevent <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser529 and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser536 phosphorylations from SE insults .

Since <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser529 and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser536 are phosphorylated by <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 41 ] , it is likely that <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ser529 / Ser536 phosphorylation may also play a role in SE - induced vasogenic edema .

Therefore , our findings indicate that both <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may be synergists to play either a direct ( by endothelial cells ) or indirect ( by astrocytes ) role in the maintenance of BBB permeability .
Neutrophil infiltration into brain parenchyma is transiently observed during the acute phase of SE ( 4 - 36 hr after SE ) and disappears thereafter [ 20 ] .
SE rapidly increases synthesis and release of chemokines in various areas of the rodent brain [ 42 ] .
Among them , <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is required for efficient neutrophil or lymphocyte recruitment to brain parenchyma [ 43 ] .

In our previous study [ 20 ] , neutrophil infiltration in the frontoparietal cortex was regulated by <extra_id_0> P2X7 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

In the PC , however , neither a P2X7 receptor agonist / antagonist nor <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( an <extra_id_0> IL-1beta antagonist <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) infusion could not affect leukocyte infiltration .

In the present study , s <extra_id_0> TNFp55R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infusion effectively inhibited neutrophil infiltration in the PC by reducing vasogenic edema formation in a <extra_id_0> MIP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent manner .

With respect to the present and our previous reports , it is therefore likely that vasogenic edema induced by <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can induce neutrophil infiltration and press injury to evoke neuronal-astroglial loss in the PC , unlike other brain regions .

In conclusion , our findings reveal that impairments of endothelial cell function via <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediated <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Thr 435 NF-kappaB phosphorylation may be involved in SE - induced vasogenic edema , which is relevant to neutrophil infiltration and neuronal-astroglial loss .
